t: God the Refuge of His People.
For the choir director. A Psalm of the sons of Korah, set to Alamoth. A Song.
God*pn is our refuge and strength, A*ln very present help in trouble.
Therefore*ln we will not fear, though the earth should change And*ln though the mountains slip into the heart of the sea;
Though*ln its waters roar and*i foam, Though*ln the mountains quake at its swelling pride. Selah.
There*ln is a river whose streams make glad the city of God, The*ln holy dwelling places of the Most High.
God*ln is in the midst of her, she will not be moved; God*ln will help her when morning dawns.
The*ln nations made an uproar, the kingdoms tottered; He*ln raised His voice, the earth melted.
The*ln Lord*s of hosts is with us; The*ln God of Jacob is our stronghold. Selah.
Come,*ln behold the works of the Lord,*s Who*ln has wrought desolations in the earth.
He*ln makes wars to cease to the end of the earth; He*ln breaks the bow and cuts the spear in two; He*ln burns the chariots with fire.
“Cease*ln striving*i and know that I am God; I*ln will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted in the earth.”
The*ln Lord*s of hosts is with us; The*ln God of Jacob is our stronghold. Selah.
